sn46.26:2.2.pli: Tassa satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ vipulaṁ mahaggataṁ appamāṇaṁ abyāpajjaṁ taṇhā pahīyati.
sn46.26:2.2.en: As they do so, craving is given up.

sn46.26:2.3.en: When craving is given up, deeds are given up.

sn46.26:2.6.pli: Tassa upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvayato vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vossaggapariṇāmiṁ vipulaṁ mahaggataṁ appamāṇaṁ abyāpajjaṁ taṇhā pahīyati
sn46.26:2.6.en: As they do so, craving is given up.

sn46.26:2.7.en: When craving is given up, deeds are given up.

mlDocs.title:
Linked Discourses 46
3. With Udāyī
26. The Ending of Craving

dn22:20.4.pli: Yaṁ loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, etthesā taṇhā pahīyamānā pahīyati, ettha nirujjhamānā nirujjhati.
dn22:20.4.en: Whatever in the world seems nice and pleasant, it is there that craving is given up and ceases.

dn22:20.6.pli: Cakkhu loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, etthesā taṇhā pahīyamānā pahīyati, ettha nirujjhamānā nirujjhati.
dn22:20.6.en: The eye in the world seems nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases. …

dn22:20.65.pli: dhammavicāro loke piyarūpaṁ sātarūpaṁ, etthesā taṇhā pahīyamānā pahīyati, ettha nirujjhamānā nirujjhati.
dn22:20.65.en: Considerations regarding thoughts in the world seem nice and pleasant, and it is there that craving is given up and ceases.

mlDocs.title:
Long Discourses 22
The Longer Discourse on Mindfulness Meditation

an4.257:3.8.pli: Yato kho, mālukyaputta, bhikkhuno taṇhā pahīnā hoti ucchinnamūlā tālāvatthukatā anabhāvaṅkatā āyatiṁ anuppādadhammā, ayaṁ vuccati, mālukyaputta, ‘bhikkhu acchecchi taṇhaṁ, vivattayi saṁyojanaṁ, sammā mānābhisamayā antamakāsi dukkhassā’”ti.
an4.257:3.8.en: That craving is given up by a mendicant, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future. Then they’re called a mendicant who has cut off craving, untied the fetters, and by rightly comprehending conceit has made an end of suffering.”
